MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Recap of Episode 1. Passy, the daughter of Verforet nobles, has asked me to interrogate a criminal who damaged her stores.
This is what I heard later. A few days back, Passy had visited the castle of Fussen, a noble from a different country but still a noble.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Très bien! What a wonderful collection you have, Fussen!

Passy looks around with a blooming smile on her face. The castle is filled with masterpieces, curiosities, and works of art that Fussen, a collector of rare items, has gathered from all over the world.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hah, I'm a little embarrassed to show it to anyone other than those who share my taste, though. I'm glad you like it, because it's a collection I'm proud of, and I've poured my heart and soul into it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Merci! I'd die just to see it! You have a wonderful hobby, Fussen.
Oh, I feel like I'm going blind just looking at it!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hah, you may gaze upon it to your heart's content,
because that's why I've invited you.

Fussen is usually a difficult person to get along with, but I guess she doesn't feel bad when people openly show their affection for her like this. She looks happily at the small, adorable aristocrat from another country and speaks calmly.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
If you like what you see here, you are welcome to take it home with you.
Of course, you will have to pay for it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes. That's why I'm here. I've heard rumors that you have something on your mind and intend to dispose of some of your collection.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hm, I've been thinking of getting serious and concentrating on the activities of the SSS. Before that, I've decided to sell off some of my collection.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Haha, it must be very expensive to maintain such a gorgeous and valuable collection.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Of course, it's not enough to ruin my family. I didn't think it would be good to keep my beloved artifacts in my castle, where no one ever comes to visit, and let them gather dust.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
The value of a work of art is determined by people. The eyes of man.
If no one can see them, then these works of art that I love are nothing more than worthless pieces of rock.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Wise words, Fussen.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: That's why I'm glad that you're willing to buy them. You understand the value of these items, and you are wealthy and can afford the cost of maintaining and managing them.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes. I'm ashamed to admit it since it's a lowly activity, but I think it's fun and worthwhile to run a business, to put the things I love into people's hands.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Haha, I suppose it's also a value from long ago that labor is despicable. It's no longer the case...Although it's sad to say, I'm making an effort to fit in.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
At the very least,
let the demise of our nobility not stain this evening...Hmm?

Fussen, who has been speaking softly and with sympathy as a fellow aristocrat, suddenly stiffens. Following her line of sight, she sees Passy shivering as she picks up one of the books on a luxurious desk.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, that's...no! Hey, Cinderella, I told you, only items to be disposed of are to be kept in this room!

In a panic, Fussen calls out to jer faithful servant, Cinderella,
a beautiful white dragon who understands human language.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Of course. You don't need those books, do you?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Obviously, I need them! Do you know how many lonely nights I've been saved by these books, you lunatic? Formal things are not the only art!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'm sorry. I was wondering if I could take this opportunity to discourage you from your rotten hobby. It seems that you're too busy indulging in your ridiculous stories to see reality.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: What's wrong with that? Some dreams are more beautiful than reality! I'll never forgive you today... these books are more valuable than any piece of art because they only come out in small numbers!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, um...
Passy flips through the pages of the book to check the contents and then in a confused manner, calls out to Fussen, who is trying to hit Cinderella with her whip.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
What the heck is this...? I thought it was a history book or something,
because it had the names of great people from all over the world that I know well.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: W-why are they all naked? And, um, why are these guys..oh, an ass.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (No! What Passy is holding is one of the most extreme books in my collection that was later banned! I've exposed it to the eyes of the innocent public at...!)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (No! It's not good for nobles of other countries to know that I have such a hobby! For some reason, I ran into a Beijing at an auction, so it's silently understood by the Eisengrad military and others!)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (It's not good for a noble from another country! If I'm not careful, the rest of the great aristocracy that inherits the Ancient Great Blood will become the laughingstock of the world! I'll be ridiculed as a pervert, since prejudice still persists in this world!)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (How did this happen!? Just when I was thinking that I'll do my best to keep my noble reputation intact, this happens! No, I can still fool her...I've got to use my brain!)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, um, Fussen. I'm embarrassed to admit that I'm not well educated enough to understand this. What kind of book is this...?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmmm. It's hard to explain, but it's...uhh...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, it's an extremely artistic book about the communion of love!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Eh, but...love between men?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's such an unholy... To my eyes, it seems somehow distorted or wrong. Because this kind of dirty...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: What did you just say, daughter of Verforet nobles!?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Dirty? Have you read the book carefully?
An insult to a character in a story I love is an insult to myself!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I don't mean to insult you! I respect your aesthetic sense
and your proud way of life.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm, I'm disappointed in you. I thought you were someone who could understand art, or at least beauty. Well, it seems I was wrong.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Eh, uh...but this is definitely strange. For example, the historical heroes that we in Verforet are so proud of are somehow distracted from politics and warfare, and they're just trying to get their way.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
There are no historical facts like this!
This is an insult to the heroes of history!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I don't give a shit about historical facts!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
The important thing is love.
If there is love, then everything else is trivial.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Passy
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
T-that's true...
Love is the most beautiful and valuable thing, but...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: That's right. Let's use that as a starting point and dig deeper. No...I'll teach the inexperienced noble from a foreign country about art from scratch. Heheheh♪

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh, you're getting excited, aren't you...?
I don't care even if it becomes an international issue, young lady.
Continue to Episode 3.
